page.title: 09HORSE RIDING IN L.STAUGHTON
page.content: Being a rural area many families keep their own horses and ponies. Children join the local pony club, Oakley Hunt North Branch, and take part in gymkhanas and other events.Most owners keep their horses and ponies in fields by day and in stables at night. The cost of a bale of hay for winter feeding is 1pound 50p. Fox Hunting is a traditional country sport in this area. The{Oakley Hunt meets in Little Staughton once or twice a year. The cost for the season is 245 pounds. A "cap" for the day is 30 pounds. The huntsmen wear pink jackets and top hats. The remainder of the hunt wear black jackets and stock. The ladies wear bowler hats or caps and occasionally ride side saddle. Other riders prefer to use the many local bridle paths.
